api_contracts.description: Returns a simple Hello World greeting message

component_logic.responsibility: Handles GET /hello requests and returns Hello World response with timestamp

interfaces.description: Returns Hello World response with current timestamp
Formats response with message, timestamp, and status

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use datetime.utcnow().isoformat() + 'Z' for ISO 8601 UTC timestamp. Return exactly 'Hello World' as message. Include status field set to 'success'. Handle any exceptions and return 500 error. Use FastAPI route decorator @app.get('/hello').

design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: API contract must use GET method for /hello endpoint. Response must be JSON format with consistent structure.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify proper error handling for unexpected failures
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Component must handle exceptions and return 500 status code. No unhandled exceptions should crash the application.
Response must always include message, timestamp, and status fields. Message must be exactly 'Hello World'.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify endpoint has minimal processing overhead
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Handler should execute in under 10ms. No database calls or external API calls. Only timestamp generation and JSON serialization.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify component follows single responsibility principle
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloWorldHandler must only handle /hello endpoint logic. No additional business logic or cross-cutting concerns.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify timestamp format is ISO 8601 compliant
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Timestamp must be in ISO 8601 format with UTC timezone (ending with 'Z'). Use datetime.utcnow().isoformat() + 'Z'.

architecture_overview: Simple single-endpoint REST API with minimal architecture. HelloWorldHandler component processes GET /hello requests and returns JSON response with Hello World message and current timestamp. No database or external dependencies required. FastAPI framework handles HTTP routing and JSON serialization.
assumptions: No authentication or authorization required for /hello endpoint
Response format includes timestamp for request traceability
No persistent storage needed for this simple endpoint
Standard HTTP status codes are sufficient (200 for success, 500 for errors)
UTC timezone is acceptable for timestamp (no user-specific timezone handling)
